title: PM-KISAN Scheme
description: Financial assistance of ₹6,000 per year for landholding farmer families.

eligibility: Landholding farmer families with cultivable land.
Aadhaar card linked to bank account is mandatory.
Excludes institutional landholders, government employees, and income tax payers.
details.benefits: ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each.
process: Register online at pmkisan.gov.in or via PM-KISAN GoI Mobile App.
e-KYC is mandatory for receiving installments.

title: Ayushman Bharat (PM-JAY)
description: Health insurance coverage of up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care.

eligibility: Rural: Families in single-room dwellings, SC/ST households, landless laborers.
Urban: 11 occupational categories like street vendors, ragpickers, domestic workers.
No restriction on family size, age, or gender.
details.benefits: Cashless cover up to ₹5 lakh/year for hospitalization, including COVID-19 treatment.
process: Check eligibility at pmjay.gov.in or call 14555.
Identify at empanelled hospital with Aadhaar or Ration Card.
Receive Ayushman Card for cashless treatment.

title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban)
description: Affordable housing for urban poor with interest subsidies.

eligibility: Family must not own a pucca house anywhere in India.
benefits: Interest subsidy up to 6.5% on home loans.
Central assistance of ₹1.5 lakh for new construction (EWS).
Subsidy on principal amount for LIG/MIG categories.
process: Apply online via pmaymis.gov.in or at Common Service Centres.
Bank loan application for CLSS subsidy.

title: Land Records & Registration
description: Digital access to land records (RoR) and property registration.

details.benefits: Transparency in land ownership, easier loan approvals, and dispute resolution.
process: Visit state-specific land record portal (e.g., Bhulekh).
Enter District, Tehsil, and Village details.

title: Domicile & Income Certificates
description: Proof of residence and income for educational and job purposes.

eligibility: Resident of the state for a specified period (usually 3-15 years).
details.benefits: Required for state quota in education, jobs, and scholarship schemes.
process: Apply via e-District portal or local Tehsildar office.
Submit proof of residence and identity.
